text: The firing squad pulled him out of his cell at a glacial dawn, and they all had to walk through a snowy field to get to the scene of the execution. The civilian guards were well protected from the cold with layers, gloves and tricorns, but they still trampled through the icy wasteland. The poor prisoner, who wore only a ragged wool jacket, rubbed his nearly petrified body as he lamented out loud the deadly cold. At a certain point, the platoon commander, exasperated with the lamentations, shouted: "Fuck, you just got martyred with the cold bastard. Think of us, we have to go back. The five most beautiful short stories in the world Conversations from the Lonely, Bogotá, 2001
title: Los cinco cuentos cortos más bellos del mundo: V
author: Gabriel García Márquez
